titleStmt.title: Will of Osmund Mosier, of Gillingham, Dorset, England, 1615

availability.p: Copyright © 2021, Christopher Alan Mosher, Shelton, Connecticut, USA.
availability.licence: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.

normalization.p: Only minor normalization where needed, if any, is indicated via markup.

punctuation.p: All punctuation marks in the source text have been retained, and are represented by appropriate Unicode code points.
Punctuation may be marked up with pc elements for clarification, but not exclusively.

quotation.p: All quotation marks have been retained, and are represented by appropriate Unicode code points.

hyphenation.p: Hyphenated words that appear at the end of a line have been retained. The hyphen, if present, is represented by the Unicode code point, and marked up with a pc element. The break="no" attribute on the lb element indicates that a single word is split across the lines.

interpretation.p: Dates, places, and names may be marked up, where useful.

graphic.url: https://mosher.mine.nu/ftm/mosher_other Media/England & Wales, Prerogative Court of Canterbury Wills, 1384-1858(10).jpg

body.ab:
Memorandum Ꞇhat Osmund Mosier of Gillingham in the Contie of ~
dorset husbandman beinge sicke of bodie but of ꝑfect mynde and memorie did vppon the sixth ~
day of October Anno Dm̃ one thousand six hundred and ffifteene by word of mouth declare ~
his last will in manner and forme followinge or the like in effecte, vi⁊t: ffirst he comended his ~
soule vnto Allmyghtie God and his bodie to the earth, And as for his worldly goodes he disposed
of them as followeth vi⁊t he gave vnto Iohn Ꞇoppes Children of Gillingham aforesaid iiij£ amongst
them, Item he gave vnto Anne Toppe the wife of the said John Toppe eight poundes of wooll ~
Item he gaue vnto his uncle Robert Mathewes Children iiij£ wch he owed him, Item he gaue vnto
the said Robert Mathewe his Coulte Item he gave vnto Ꞇhomas Mathewe his two Children his
Ꞇwo yearling bullockes, Item he gave vnto his brother William Mosier iiij£, Item he gave to ~ ~
Edward Churchills Children and the widowe Ꞇaylors Children Eight sheepe amonge them All the
Rest and residue of his goodes his debtes paid his ffunerall discharged and his legacies satisfied
he gave vnto his uncle Robert Mathewe aforesaid whome he named and appointed to bee his Executor
In the presence of Iohn Michell William Burton Iohn Allen and others
body.p:
Probatum fuit Ꞇestamentum suprascriptum apud London coram venerabili viro ~
mag̃ro Batholomeo Iesopp legum doctore Surrogato venerabilis viri domini Iohannis Benet
militis legum etiam doctoris Curie prerogative Cantuarienses mag̃ri Custodes sine Comissarij
legitime~
legitimi constituti Septimo die mensis Januarij Anno Domini iuxta cursum et coputacõem
Eccl̃ie Anglicane millesimo sexcentesimo decimo quinto Iuramento Robert Matewe executoris
dicti defuncti de bene et fideliter Administrando &c ad sancta dei Evangelia Iurate. / execꝛ
